security_audit.summary: This skill provides GitHub issue creation assistance with Python helper scripts for validation and scope detection. The scripts use subprocess to invoke git and gh CLI tools, and read project configuration files. All capabilities are appropriate for the stated purpose of issue management automation.

content.user_title: Create well-formed GitHub issues with proper labels
content.value_statement: Creating GitHub issues with proper conventions takes time and attention to detail. This skill validates issue titles, suggests appropriate labels, and ensures every issue includes required metadata like scope labels and priority levels.
actual_capabilities: Validates issue titles follow naming conventions without type prefixes
Suggests appropriate type, priority, and scope labels for issues
Auto-detects scope labels from branch names and project context
Provides bug report, feature request, and standard issue templates
Enforces required metadata before issue creation
Creates issues with proper labels using GitHub CLI
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed and authenticated
Cannot create issues without proper scope label configuration
Does not modify existing issues, only creates new ones
Depends on project having label taxonomy defined

use_cases.title: Standardize issue creation
use_cases.description: Ensure all contributors create issues with consistent labels, titles, and metadata structure.

use_cases.title: Track work by scope
use_cases.description: Automatically detect component scope from branch names and add proper scope labels to issues.

use_cases.title: Review issue quality
use_cases.description: Validate that proposed issue titles follow conventions and suggest improvements before creation.

prompt_templates.title: Quick issue creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an issue for fixing the login timeout bug in the authentication module

prompt_templates.title: With context
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an issue for adding dark mode support based on the current feature branch

prompt_templates.title: With validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Is this a good issue title: [BUG] Fix the crash when saving files? If not, suggest a better one

prompt_templates.title: Bulk creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create issues for implementing user authentication with proper labels and scope for the auth component

output_examples.input: Create an issue for adding dark mode support
output: Issue Title: Add dark mode support

best_practices: Always include scope labels to enable context-aware filtering and commit integration
Use imperative mood in titles without type prefixes like [BUG] or [FEATURE]
Define acceptance criteria before creating issues to clarify completion requirements
Ask clarifying questions about project board, milestones, and relationships when creating multiple issues
anti_patterns: Using type prefixes in titles (e.g., [BUG] Login fails) instead of relying on labels
Creating issues without scope labels that identify the affected component
Skipping acceptance criteria which leads to unclear completion requirements
Using task lists instead of GraphQL parent-child relationships for sub-issues

faq.question: What GitHub CLI permissions are required?
faq.answer: Requires repo scope for issue creation and label management. Install via gh auth login.

faq.question: How many labels are required per issue?
faq.answer: Exactly three: one type (bug, feature, enhancement), one priority (high, medium, low), and one scope.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with GitHub Enterprise?
faq.answer: Yes, works with any GitHub instance where gh CLI is authenticated including Enterprise Server.

faq.question: Does this skill store or transmit my data?
faq.answer: No. All processing is local. Scripts only invoke gh CLI commands to interact with GitHub.

faq.question: What happens if scope cannot be auto-detected?
faq.answer: The skill prompts you to manually select a scope from available project scopes before creating.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub issue templates?
faq.answer: This skill provides real-time validation and suggestions during creation, while GitHub templates only define body formats.
